text: Cephalotaxus mannii is a species of plant in the family Taxaceae. It is a tree up to about tall, native to southern China, northeast India, Laos, northern Thailand, northern Myanmar and northern Vietnam. While the species is widespread, its populations are fragmented and it is threatened by cutting for timber as well as for using its bark and leaves for medicinal extracts. Sometimes (e.g.) the species Cephalotaxus griffithii and Cephalotaxus hainanensis are considered synonyms of this species. ==References== mannii Category:Trees of China Category:Flora of Assam (region) Category:Trees of Indo-China Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Taxa named by Joseph Dalton Hooker
title: Cephalotaxus mannii
